intro: Cebatha pubescens, commonly known as the hairy cebatha, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a central stigma. Cebatha pubescens is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in semi-arid climates.
